btrplace.plan

Interface ReconfigurationPlan

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Action>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultReconfigurationPlan

    public interface ReconfigurationPlan
extends Iterable<Action>
    A reconfiguration plan is a set of actions to execute to reconfigure an infrastructure starting from a given model.

    Actions must be sorted using a TimedBasedActionComparator that differentiate simultaneous but not equals actions.

    Author:
    Fabien Hermenier

      Get the model that is used as a starting point to perform the reconfiguration.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrigin

        Model getOrigin()
        Get the model that is used as a starting point to perform the reconfiguration.
        Returns:
        the original model

      • add

        boolean add(Action a)
        Add a new action to a plan.
        Parameters:
        a - the action to add
        Returns:
        true iff the action has been added

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Get the number of actions in the plan.
        Returns:
        a positive integer

      • getDuration

        int getDuration()
        Return the theoretical duration of a reconfiguration plan.
        Returns:
        the end moment of the last executed action

      • getActions

        Set<Action> getActions()
        Get all the actions to perform.
        Returns:
        a list of actions. May be empty

      • getResult

        Model getResult()
        Get the resulting model once all the actions are executed.
        Returns:
        the resulting model or null if the plan cannot be applied

      • isApplyable

        boolean isApplyable()
        Check if all the actions can be applied according to their schedule. In practice, it calls every Action.apply(btrplace.model.Model) while respecting their ordering
        Returns:
        true iff the actions can be applied

      • getDirectDependencies

        Set<Action> getDirectDependencies(Action a)
        Get the actions that have to be executed before a given action. Transitive dependencies are ignored.
        Parameters:
        a - the action
        Returns:
        a set of dependencies that may be empty.

      • getReconfigurationApplier

        ReconfigurationPlanApplier getReconfigurationApplier()
        Get the applier that is used to simulate the actions application on the starting model.
        Returns:
        the applier in use.

      • setReconfigurationApplier

        void setReconfigurationApplier(ReconfigurationPlanApplier ra)
        Set the applier to use to simulate the actions application.
        Parameters:
        ra - the applier to use
